Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, exterior grooved at one end, with remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an invoice.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.150, pl.2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87671) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87671)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 191 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
